intro: Deinandra halliana, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance. Deinandra halliana is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
